TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , has the citizenship of GPE and GPE . She was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . Her previous application ( no . CARDINAL ) was declared inadmissible by a ORG on DATE .
The facts of the present case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE the applicant decided to repatriate to GPE from her emigration in GPE . Upon her arrival in GPE , her personal belongings were taken into customs storage pending the termination of the repatriation proceedings . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request for recovery of her belongings before the end of those proceedings . Her administrative appeal was to no avail .
On DATE the applicant ’s repatriation was acknowledged by ORG .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s administrative complaint about the denial of recovery of her belongings .

Upon the applicant ’s repeated complaints , on CARDINAL DATE ORG established that no advance in the applicant ’s customs affair had taken place since DATE , given that the applicant had failed to proceed to obtain an identity card . On DATE the Deputy Head of ORG informed her that as long as she did not deposit her NORP passport , no identity card and , consequently , no certificate for customs clearance could be issued .

On DATE the applicant brought a compensation action before the GPE XX / XXI District Court . The action was subsequently forwarded to ORG to which the applicant submitted on CARDINAL DATE that she sought compensation from ORG on account of the customs authorities’ reluctance to proceed with the customs clearance of her belongings and on account of the damages which had resulted from their long storage .
On DATE ORG dismissed the action . The applicant appealed .
On DATE ORG , acting as second instance , held a hearing and upheld the first - instance judgment .
On DATE the applicant filed with ORG a petition for review by ORG . She also requested that a legal - aid lawyer be appointed for her . Subsequently she left GPE and returned to GPE .

ORG appointed a legal - aid lawyer . On DATE ORG notified this decision to the applicant using her last known address in GPE . DATE this notification was returned by the post on account of the fact that the applicant had moved out without having left her new address behind .
On DATE the applicant ’s legal - aid lawyer filed a completed petition for review .

On DATE the review bench of ORG upheld the second - instance decision . This decision was served , in accordance with LAW of LAW , on the applicant ’s lawyer on DATE . On DATE the lawyer forwarded the decision to the applicant ’s last known address in GPE .
The applicant submits that she obtained a copy of the decision only on DATE when she received , under her NORP address , her legal - aid lawyer ’s repeated communication in the matter .
